unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Data Plan Restructuring Amidst Increased Demand**
normalised: telecom sector sees data plan restructuring amidst increased demand

unnormalised: New Delhi – Indian telecom operators are reportedly revisiting their data plan structures following a surge in data consumption, particularly in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. Experts at IIT Delhi predict mobile data usage will increase by 40% in the next fiscal year.
normalised: new delhi – indian telecom operators are reportedly revisiting their data plan structures following a surge in data consumption, particularly in tier two and tier three cities. experts at I I T delhi predict mobile data usage will increase by forty percent in the next fiscal year.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio are exploring options to offer more tailored plans, moving away from purely volume-based offerings. This shift is in response to consumer demand for plans better suited to their specific needs, such as video streaming or online gaming. Dr. Sharma, a leading telecom analyst, noted that "consumers are now more discerning, wanting value for money and not just raw data".

unnormalised: The average data consumption per user currently stands at 15 GB per month, with some exceeding 50 GB. New plans are expected to launch before Diwali. Idea Cellular is also expected to announce revisions. The operators are also investing heavily in expanding 5G infrastructure to support the growing demand, aiming to cover 70% of India with 5G in the next two years. Investments of over Rs. 20,000 Crores are earmarked for network upgrades and spectrum acquisition across India, including establishing more towers per sq km in dense urban areas.
